name: Constrained Counterexample Search
description: Search for counterexample to τ ≤ 2ν within highly constrained graph classes. Even proving non-existence in subclasses is publishable.
known_non_counterexamples: Random graphs G(n,p) - achieve τ ≈ 1.5ν asymptotically
Strongly regular graphs tested - all satisfy

literature.note: No improvement in 26 years suggests tightness unclear
Gap between fractional and integral is the mystery

connection_to_our_lemmas.tau_star_gap: We've proven τ*(G) ≤ 2ν. Counterexample needs integral gap

attack_strategy.approach: Constrained search in algebraic/Cayley graphs with χ ≥ 5, tw ≥ 7
candidates: Generalized Petersen graphs with high chromatic number
Graph products that amplify chromatic number

formalization_needed: Small case exhaustion for ν=4, n≤20
value_of_negative_results: Proving 'no counterexample exists in class C' is publishable if C is natural (e.g., Cayley graphs, split graphs)
